meanings.definition: A particular time or instance of an event.
meanings.sent1: On the special occasion of her birthday, she received many gifts.
meanings.sent2: The wedding was a joyous occasion for the entire family.
meanings.sent3: It was a rare occasion to see all the siblings together in one place.
meanings.sent4: The graduation ceremony was an occasion filled with pride and accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: The holiday season is always a festive occasion for everyone.

meanings.definition: A reason or cause for doing something.
meanings.sent1: His lack of experience was the occasion for his nervousness during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The poor weather was the occasion for the cancellation of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting his lines was the occasion for much laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected arrival of guests was the occasion for a quick clean-up of the house.
meanings.sent5: The broken oven was the occasion for ordering takeout for dinner.

meanings.definition: An opportunity or suitable time for doing something.
meanings.sent1: She took the occasion to thank everyone for their hard work.
meanings.sent2: The long weekend provided the perfect occasion for a road trip.
meanings.sent3: The power outage was an occasion to bond over board games by candlelight.
meanings.sent4: The delay in the meeting was an occasion to catch up on emails.
meanings.sent5: The arrival of the new year is an occasion to reflect on the past and plan for the future.
